citation.article-title: Actinomyces coleocanis sp. nov., from the vagina of a dog.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinomyces coleocanis sp. nov.
Actinomyces coleocanis (co.le.o.can'is. Gr. n. koleos vagina; L. gen. n. canis of the dog; N.L. gen. n. coleocanis of the vagina of a dog)
Cells are straight to slightly curved rods, some of which exhibit branching.
Cells stain Gram-positive and are non-aciD-fast and non-motile.
Succinic acid and lactic acid are the main end products of glucose metabolism.Using API systems, acid is produced from D-glucose, glycogen, maltose, lactose and pullulan.

Acid is not produced from l-arabinose, D-arabitol, cyclodextrin, mannitol, melibiose, melezitose, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, N-acetyl β-glucosamine, raffinose, ribose, sorbitol, sucrose, tagatose, trehalose or D-xylose.
Aesculin, gelatin and hippurate are not hydrolysed.
Alanine-phenylalanine-proline arylamidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, glycyl-tryptophan arylamidase and pyrazinamidase (weak reaction) are produced.
Arginine dihydrolase, alkaline phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, β-mannosidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase and urease are not produced.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The type strain is strain M343/98/2T (=CCUG 41708T=CIP 106873T).
Isolated from the vagina of a cocker spaniel dog.
